form.label: Hot Bucket Roll Info
form.description: How often are buckets rolling and what are the timespans of events in the bucket.

details.p:
The information shown below is a one to one of buckets that have rolled in the time frame specified above from hot to warm.
Shown is the index the bucket is for, the type of bucket (normal vs quarantine), the earliest and latest timestamp of the events in the bucket, the date span of the bucket (days+hours:minutes:seconds), and the bucket size.
When data is rolled to frozen based off of time, the bucket will roll when the latest timestamped event meets the timebased retention. Improperly on-boarded data and improper timestamps can cause a wide date span. Only one quarantine bucket can be open at a time and if the data doesn't fit in that bucket it will be written to a normal bucket if active writing is going on in the quarantine bucket.
Smaller buckets means more buckets to search through. Wider date spans means more events to search through to get the data requested from a search.

search.query: index=_internal host="$idx_host_tok$" sourcetype=splunkd component=HotBucketRoller idx=* | eval bucket_type=if(like(from, "hot_quar_%"),"Quarantine", "Normal") | rex field=to "db_(?<latest_time>\d{10})_(?<earliest_time>\d{10})" | eval latest_btime=strftime(latest_time,"%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S") | eval earliest_btime=strftime(earliest_time,"%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S") | eval date_span=(latest_time - earliest_time) | table idx bucket_type earliest_btime latest_btime date_span size bid | rename idx AS "Index" bucket_type AS "Bucket Type" earliest_btime AS "Earliest Event Time in Bucket" latest_btime AS "Latest Event Time in Bucket" date_span AS "Date Span for Bucket" size AS "Bucket Size" bid as _bid | sort - "Date Span for Bucket" | fieldformat "Date Span for Bucket" = tostring('Date Span for Bucket', "duration") | fieldformat "Bucket Size"=case('Bucket Size'>=(1024*1024*1024*1024),round('Bucket Size'/(1024*1024*1024*1024),0)."TB", 'Bucket Size'>=(1024*1024*1024),round('Bucket Size'/(1024*1024*1024),0)."GB", 'Bucket Size'>=(1024*1024),round('Bucket Size'/(1024*1024),0)."MB", 'Bucket Size'>=1024,round('Bucket Size'/1024,0)."KB", 1=1,'Bucket Size'."B")
index=_internal host="$idx_host_tok$" sourcetype=splunkd component=HotBucketRoller idx=* | timechart count by idx limit=0
